name: Mathematics
aboutCourse: Through Liverpool Hope's well-established partnerships with schools in the region, you will be able to gain experience of teaching Mathematics across a wide range of student ability. The Mathematics team works closely with experienced practitioners in schools who support student teacher progression on placement.  The pedagogy of mathematics is an important emphasis on the course, and trainees will encounter innovative and engaging approaches to mathematics teaching, enabling them to become confident mathematics practitioners.  Trainees will have opportunities for involvement in the wider mathematics education community, through for example enrichment masterclasses and intervention projects. The employment rates for the course are outstanding, as are the completion and exit grades.  Schools placements will cover the 11-16 age range, along with a KS5 enhancement.
interviewProcess:
If called for interview, the day will take the following format or similar to assess key skills and attributes:

1. Presentation: you will be asked to give a presentation on a topic showing how you would deliver this to a class. Details are sent out with the interview letter.

2. Interview: a set of questions designed to ascertain your ideas and knowledge on a range of educational issues.

3. Group Task: A task will be set which requires you to work collaboratively in groups around a generic educational topic and present your findings to other candidates

4. Literacy Test: A 20 minute written task to assess your standard of written English (grammar, spelling, punctuation etc)

5. You will be notified of the outcome of your interview within seven to ten days via UCAS Track and letter.

Upon receipt of your acceptance of the place offered, if successful, you will receive a pre-course pack outlining activities which will need to be completed before the course starts, in order to begin your training immediately and prepare you for the start of the course in September.

Other requirements and recommendations from your interview may also be enclosed.

If unsuccessful you will receive a letter giving basic details of the reasons for this.
howSchoolPlacementsWork:
At Liverpool Hope we have strong and long standing partnerships with a wide range of schools across the North West. Our partnership includes over 300 schools encompassing faith based settings, community schools, academies and schools from the private sector. All our partner schools share our vision for creating the Hope Teacher and are skilled at providing you with the practical support to become an outstanding classroom practitioner. 

High quality partnership schools are selected for students according to their training requirements. We match placements carefully ensuring students gain a range of experience in different schools and settings building on their prior knowledge and experience. All partner schools have experienced, trained mentors who will support this you to succeed. 

Postgraduate students complete two assessed professional placements during their training. Placements increase in length as you progress through your training preparing you for the real world of teaching.
